cofh.api.transport

Interface IEnderEnergyHandler


  • public interface IEnderEnergyHandler
    This interface is implemented on Ender Attuned objects which can receive Energy (Redstone Flux).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canReceiveEnergy()
      This should be checked to see if the Ender Attuned object can currently receive energy (Redstone Flux).
      boolean canSendEnergy()
      Return whether or not the Ender Attuned object can currently send energy (Redstone Flux).
      boolean clearFrequency() 
      java.lang.String getChannelString() 
      int getFrequency() 
      int receiveEnergy(int energy, boolean simulate)
      This tells the Ender Attuned object to receive energy.
      boolean setFrequency(int frequency) 

    • Method Detail

      • canSendEnergy

        boolean canSendEnergy()
        Return whether or not the Ender Attuned object can currently send energy (Redstone Flux).

      • canReceiveEnergy

        boolean canReceiveEnergy()
        This should be checked to see if the Ender Attuned object can currently receive energy (Redstone Flux). Note: In practice, this can (and should) be used to ensure that something does not send to itself.

      • receiveEnergy

        int receiveEnergy(int energy,
                boolean simulate)
        This tells the Ender Attuned object to receive energy. This returns the amount remaining, *not* the amount received - a return of 0 means that all energy was received!
        Parameters:
        energy - Amount of energy to be received.
        simulate - If TRUE, the result will only be simulated.
        Returns:
        Amount of energy that is remaining (or would be remaining, if simulated).

      • getChannelString

        java.lang.String getChannelString()

      • getFrequency

        int getFrequency()

      • setFrequency

        boolean setFrequency(int frequency)

      • clearFrequency

        boolean clearFrequency()
